components.description:
A locked (closed) padlock, as used to secure a latch or chain, or as an icon for a secure internet connection, private account, or locked device. Generally depicted with a gold base and silver shackle. WhatsApp’s design is silver.

Commonly used for content concerning safety, security, privacy, and protection as well as various senses of lock, e.g., locked in/down.

This emoji does not display in page titles on Apple’s Safari web browser, presumably to prevent less reputable sites from pretending to be secure (encrypted using HTTPS).

Additionally, this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with private accounts on the platform. Learn more here.

See also: üîè Locked With Pen and üîê Locked With Key.
components.title: Lock

title: Lock

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A locked (closed) padlock, used either¬†in the real world to¬†secure an object; or as a symbol of security or SSL certificate on the web. Fun  http://emojipedia.org/lock/
emoji_net_data.name: locked

bn:00060144n: A detachable lock; has a hinged shackle that can be passed through the staple of a hasp or the links in a chain and then snapped shut
Portable locks with a shackle that may be passed through an opening
Padlocks are portable locks with a shackle that may be passed through an opening to protect against unauthorized use, theft, vandalism, or harm.
A detachable lock that can be used to secure something by means of a sliding or hinged shackle

bn:00051771n: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.
A fastener fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed
A lock is a mechanical or electronic fastening device that is released by a physical object, by supplying secret information, or by a combination thereof.

bn:00023218n: A prearranged reply to the challenge of a sentry.
An authentication credential similar to a password, consisting of numbers.
A secret word or phrase known only to a restricted group
A group element, expressed as a product of group elements.
A string of characters used to log in to a computer or network, to access a level in a video game, etc.
In military terminology, a countersign is a sign, word, or any other signal previously agreed upon and required to be exchanged between a sentry or guard and anybody approaching his or her post.
A password is a word or string of characters used for user authentication to prove identity or access approval to gain access to a resource, which should be kept secret from those not allowed access.
Used for user authentication to prove identity or access approval
A prearranged reply to the challenge of a sentry or a guard; a password or signal by which friends can be known from enemies
A sign used by a sentry or guard.
The response to a sign or signal.
In group theory, a word is any written product of group elements and their inverses.
A string of characters, known only to a user, used, along with a user name, to log in to some computer or network etc.
A product of group elements and their inverses
A string of characters used for authentication on a digital device.
A string of characters entered by a user to verify his or her identity to a network or to a local computer, device, or client, or to sign in to an account, app, and so on.
